comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
Hedley Bruce New was the son of George Hedley New and Elizabeth Crane New (nee Coles) of New Malden, Surrey.  In 1912 they were living at Cerne Cottage, Worrin Road, Shenfield, Essex.  Both Hedley Bruce New and his younger brother, Athelstan William New, were commissioned into the Essex Regiment.  (Captain Athelstan New was killed in action on 5th May 1918 while serving as the Regimental Signals Officer with 2nd Battalion Essex Regiment).

After volunteering and attachment to the RFC, Headley Bruce New learned to fly at the London Aerodrome, Collindale, Hendon in July 1916.  He was in the Beatty School there, flying Beatty-Wright and Caudron biplanes.

In October 1917, 3rd Squadron RFC had just converted to the Sopwith Camel.

In Flight Magazine of 4th April 1918, Lt H B New of 4th Essex att. RFC "Previously missing is now reported killed".
 
Lt Hedley Bruce New is also commemorated on the Brentwood Memorial Cross, Shenfield Rd, Brentwood, Essex.//

comment.author: 60445511@N05
comment._content: Also commemorated on St.Marys Church Shenfield WW1 memorial plaque
